title: Riot, if you think Zhonya's is balanced, fine, but give us other options.
body:
Myself and many other players do not think the active of Zhonya's hourglass alone is worth 1,000 gold. It's not a gold efficient item and I don't have a huge incentive to pay for it's completion unless I really, really value that active. It's great on champions like Heimerdinger and Swain, and against champions like Zed, but it's simply not reliably worth that much. There are plenty of cases where you don't want to use the active, and you lose the trade because you're basically just missing 1,000 gold in your build. On the other hand, Maw's passive is ALWAYS useful. It protects you from death in ways far better than guardian angel or Zhonya's, and is extremely gold efficient while doing so. Also, it's quite easy to play around Zhonya's active. If you're inhibited by a stun, silence, or knockup, you can't use the active to save yourself. Most champions which could have most of their damage countered by stasis such as Syndra, Annie, Cho'gath, etc have CC which allows them to completely prevent the active.

So if you think it's okay and refuse to un-nerf/rework it, okay, but at least give us other options. Maw of Malmortius is making the game an absolute nightmare for mages. Your enemy laner can just buy a hexdrinker and win by virtue of having an extremely powerful item, no matter how ahead you are. AD champions have 2 extremely strong and gold efficient anti-AP items {{item:3139}} {{item:3156}}  while AP champions get an 87% gold efficient items which freezes them in place, allowing enemies to catch up or their abilities to go off cooldown. 

This isn't a thread about Zhonya's, it about AP champions not having any good anti-AD options while anti-AP items are some of the most gold efficient and strongest items in the entire game. I don't care what happens to Zhonya's as long as AP champions get better options. Personally I like Moonflair Spellblade and Wooglet's Witchcap, but I don't think they belong in summoner's rift. We need a new AP/AR item.

Honestly Maw and Scimitar should be nerfed first. I really don't want to see AP items as overloaded as Maw and Scimitar.

Honestly it isn't even that Zhonyas sucks. It's a niche pick that is awesome when certain champions take it. But AD -> AP is so much better than AP -> AD. I'd be happy with simply nerfing maw to maybe make its passive an active, so you actually have to use it when you're dying. Or reduce the stats. Or just.. something.

I'm fine with this as well. When you can build an item that is meant to counter something or protect you, it really shouldn't have 0 downsides. But, regardless, Ap champions are screwed over in the AR department.

I'm quite hesitant to endorse the idea of another AP + armor item, simply because it has the potential to make champions that synergize with ROA or Rylais overpowered. Let's say they add a new ap armor item and it gives 40-50 armor. If you're someone like swain, you can then build ROA, Zhonyas, new item, rylais and proceed to have over 200 armor depending on runes, with a very substantial hp pool. On top of having 400+ ap. Throw a situational abyssal or spirit visage in there, or a liandries, and you have an AP drain tank that cannot be bursted and still has formidable damage. Being able to double stack ap and armor efficiently would make it really difficult to deal with someone like Swain. As much as forums bitch about tank Yi, a new armor + ap item could easily create an AP version of tank Yi in the form of Swain. Or Vlad, or any ap that does sustained dps and does well with building hp + ap. Who knows, top lane AP bruiser Sejuani or Maokai, or Malphite could become op as fuck. With just a ROA Mao's W does 15% of your max hp. Now imagine him with an efficient way to build tanky but still have 300+ ap. Doesn't sound fun to play against does it?
Sure you have an easier time vs AD champs, but the consequences of introducing a new item like this has way more impact than just AD vs AP mid match ups.
All I'm saying is be careful what you ask for.

I wouldn't mind seeing an AP armor item with an automatic shield like Maw, but when it triggers you are slowed or have your abilities use twice as much mana as normal while the shield persists. Something that can save you, but comes at a cost, similar to how Xerath is allowed to have long range but is slowed while he is charging up his Q.
Only if they nerf Maw as well. Maw has no real cost to its active; it just happens. If Riot does release an AP maw, such a discrepancy would not go unnoticed, and will be heavily criticized.

To clarify, I think Maw itself is fine; what I don't like is hexdrinker, which is such a good rush. It gets the panic button power of Zhonya much earlier and makes it very difficult to burst your. Pushing that power on to the final item and delaying that spike, with some tuning, seems fine to me.

Right. A lot of people don't understand that, when people complain about Maw, they are more complaining about Maw's build path, not the finished item. It's like when people were calling Frozen Mallet a terrible item. It's not because of the item itself, it's because all the items in the build path were garbage.

Oh, you mean like Zhonia's is right now? Hm...

The only difference is that Zhonia's is REQUIRED for laning against assassins and the active is something that most mages NEED when their team fucks up, especially at low elo.

As for a Maw clone to mages, I doubt Riot would be *that* lazy, just slapping something together to appease people in the community without actually trying to balance things out or take into account how the item is used in the first place. Riot only realistically needs to do one of two things:

1) Remove Hexdrinker and QSS, or make them much more expensive and/or not so powerful; in their current state they are far too cheap and their bonuses discourage you from finishing the items they build into into the late game, allowing assassins to build more offensive options after buying a tiny 1300 gold item.

2) Buff Seeker's Armguard with some meaningful effect that can keep it as effective or nearly as effective as Hexdrinker or Quicksilver Sash.  These items may cost 100-ish more gold than Armguard, but it's clear that that 100 gold discrepancy is nowhere near costly enough to offset how much more effective these items are.

Alterantively, they could just give us a new defensive AP item, but that's a lot more work, and another totally new item to balance. I feel like we kind of have the tools we need, but they're just nerfed into the ground because mages used to be so OP. I get that Zhonia's active is a game changer, and if Riot thinks the active is worth 1000 gold, fine. Just make Seeker's Armguard less horrible.

Actually, Maw of Mal is extremely difficult to deal with as well. Hexdrinker is more problematic technichally, but Maw is just way to effecienct. The item is already more effecient than Zhonyas even with the Zhonyas active included. The whole "But you still build zhonyas" argument is so stupid because you have to build maw of mal anyways. You know Maw of Mal is broken when people practically look for an excuse to build it. Oh they have a {{champion:16}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:238}} comp? Better get mal for that nasty soraka Q and shyvana mixed damage.

AD assassins don't need maw to win lane against an AP champion. The opposite, however, is true. AP mages need the active to survive a full combo from these AD assassins after they build pretty much any item and hit level 6. There is no other option for AP mids, and, again, no AP mid wants to build Zhonia's right now, because the stats are crap. You pay 1050 gold for the active and 5 AP more than the build path.

Meanwhile, assassins at least can choose between Maw or Mercurial Scimitar. What you're talking about is counterplay. You build Maw because it makes your lane easier and gives you a higher chance to win, but the same can be said of Hexdrinker because it does pretty much the same thing.  You get more than enough useful stats out of Maw than Mages get out of Zhonia's.

Maw gives you more magic resist than Zhonia's gives armor, you get a bunch of AD (~20 less ad than items that give the maximum ad in the game) and armor pen. Zhonia's gives 80 AP, 40 less than it used to, and 40 less than the item that gives the most AP in the game, and has no spell pen. You should want to build Maw in every game, because as long as the enemy team isn't bad, they'll have a comp with some magic damage in it.

Just played a game with a {{champion:134}} mid vs a {{champion:92}}. Of course the Syndra had to rush a {{item:3157}} in that matchup to not get murdered, and she actually didnt feed and did fair in that lane. The issue however was she had no mana items because of her zhonyas, and every, single, time, she tried to roam or we tried to gank, she had no mana. Its just unfair that ADs dont have to build a mana item so there is absolutely no drawbacks to building defensive, whereas with APs it is basically sacrificing the possibility of winning lane by going defensive.

Another big flaw. Most assassins either have energy (which regenerates very quickly, and is much easier to manage than mana) or don't need to use a lot of mana, except when they full-burst you down, after which they don't need mana to harass you anymore, because you're fucking dead!

This is exactly the kind of shit that the Riot balance team needs to consider, because they seriously don't have a good concept of how these matchups go. Against AD assassins, the game has officially become this for mages:

-Impossible to roam from the mid lane
-Will always be mana-starved
-Will have to hug tower all game, even after Zhonia's is complete
-Farming is going to suck because Assassin's harass usually either leads to their main combo to destroy you, or gets you painfully low
-Locking into one item build for the first... half of the game, just about
-No one can gank for you, unless it's a 2-man  gank

Yeah, seems fair. Make them suffer for those seasons where they were either overpowered or just kind of dominant. That'll teach 'em.
